meanings.sent1: The tall tree was overshadowing the small flower.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds were overshadowing the sun, causing a shadow to fall over the field.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was overshadowing the sleeping dog, playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her worries were overshadowing her happiness, darkening her mood.
meanings.sent5: The looming mountain was overshadowing the entire landscape, blocking out the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem less important or impressive by comparison
meanings.sent1: His loud voice was overshadowing the other students in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The grand fireworks display was overshadowing the small sparklers at the party.
meanings.sent3: The flashy new car was overshadowing his old bicycle, making it look dull in comparison.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for singing was overshadowing his attempts at playing the guitar.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon sign was overshadowing the small shop next to it, drawing all the attention.

meanings.definition: The state of being more important or noticeable than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: Her success in the competition was overshadowing the achievements of others.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the sunset was overshadowing the noise of the city.
meanings.sent3: The popularity of the new movie was overshadowing the older films in the cinema.
meanings.sent4: His charisma was overshadowing the other candidates in the election.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread was overshadowing all other scents in the bakery.
